verses.verse: To the chief Musician,<WH5329> A Psalm<WH4210> for the sons<WH1121> of Korah.<WH7141> Hear<WH8085> this,<WH2063> all<WH3605> ye people;<WH5971> give ear,<WH238> all<WH3605> ye inhabitants<WH3427> of the world: <WH2465>
Both <WH1571> low<WH120> and<WH1571> high,<WH376> rich<WH6223> and poor,<WH34> together.<WH3162>
My mouth<WH6310> shall speak<WH1696> of wisdom;<WH2454> and the meditation<WH1900> of my heart<WH3820> shall be of understanding.<WH8394>
I will incline<WH5186> mine ear<WH241> to a parable:<WH4912> I will open<WH6605> my dark saying<WH2420> upon the harp.<WH3658>
Wherefore <WH4100> should I fear<WH3372> in the days<WH3117> of evil,<WH7451> when the iniquity<WH5771> of my heels<WH6119> shall compass me about?<WH5437>
They that trust<WH982> in<WH5921> their wealth,<WH2428> and boast themselves<WH1984> in the multitude<WH7230> of their riches;<WH6239>
None <WH3808> of them can by any means<WH6299> redeem<WH6299> his brother,<WH251> nor<WH3808> give<WH5414> to God<WH430> a ransom<WH3724> for him:
(For the redemption<WH6306> of their soul<WH5315> is precious,<WH3365> and it ceaseth<WH2308> forever: )<WH5769>
That he should still<WH5750> live<WH2421> forever,<WH5331> and not<WH3808> see<WH7200> corruption.<WH7845>
For <WH3588> he seeth<WH7200> that wise men<WH2450> die,<WH4191> likewise<WH3162> the fool<WH3684> and the brutish person<WH1198> perish,<WH6> and leave<WH5800> their wealth<WH2428> to others.<WH312>

Their inward thought<WH7130> is, that their houses<WH1004> shall continue forever,<WH5769> and their dwelling places<WH4908> to all generations;<WH1755> <WH1755> they call<WH712> <WH5921> their lands<WH127> after their own names.<WH8034>
Nevertheless man<WH120> being in honor<WH3366> abideth<WH3885> not:<WH1077> he is like<WH4911> the beasts<WH929> that perish.<WH1820>
This <WH2088> their way<WH1870> is their folly:<WH3689> yet their posterity<WH310> approve<WH7521> their sayings.<WH6310> Selah.<WH5542>

Like sheep<WH6629> they are laid<WH8371> in the grave;<WH7585> death<WH4194> shall feed<WH7462> on them; and the upright<WH3477> shall have dominion<WH7287> over them in the morning;<WH1242> and their beauty<WH6697> shall consume<WH1086> in the grave<WH7585> from their dwelling.<WH4480> <WH2073>
But <WH389> God<WH430> will redeem<WH6299> my soul<WH5315> from the power<WH4480> <WH3027> of the grave:<WH7585> for<WH3588> he shall receive<WH3947> me. Selah.<WH5542>
Be not<WH408> thou afraid<WH3372> when<WH3588> one<WH376> is made rich,<WH6238> when<WH3588> the glory<WH3519> of his house<WH1004> is increased;<WH7235>
For when<WH3588> he dieth<WH4194> he shall carry<WH3947> nothing<WH3808> <WH3605> away: his glory<WH3519> shall not<WH3808> descend<WH3381> after<WH310> him.
Though <WH3588> while he lived<WH2416> he blessed<WH1288> his soul:<WH5315> and men will praise<WH3034> thee, when<WH3588> thou doest well<WH3190> to thyself.
He shall go<WH935> to<WH5704> the generation<WH1755> of his fathers;<WH1> they shall never<WH5704> <WH5331> <WH3808> see<WH7200> light.<WH216>
Man <WH120> that is in honor,<WH3366> and understandeth<WH995> not,<WH3808> is like<WH4911> the beasts<WH929> that perish.<WH1820>
